description: Erection of a three bedroom attached house following demolition of an existing side garage adjacent to the existing house.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (12102-PA-01, 1201-PA-02, 12101-PA-03, 12101-PA-04, 12101-PA-05 & Design and Access Statement. Received on 18/05/2021: Energy Statement. Received on 29/07/2021; 12101-PA-06B, 12101-PA-07B, 12101-PA-08B, 12101-PA-09B, 12101-PA-10A, 12101-PA-11B & 12101-PA-12A. Received on 03/11/2021) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the two-storey three bedroom house hereby approved shall match those used in the existing building at 64 Ruskin Avenue.

Condition : 4 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm on Mondays to Friday and 9am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Prior to any demolition and construction work, neighbours shall be given details outlining construction timeframes (including when demolition and piling will take place).

Condition : 5 - The ground floor shower room window formed in the front elevation as shown on drawing numbers 12101-PA-06B & 12101-PA-09B and the first floor bathroom windows in the rear elevation as shown on drawing numbers 12101-PA-07B & 12101-PA-10A of the hereby approved two-storey three bedroom house shall be obscure glazed, hinged to open inwards and shall not be repaired or replaced otherwise than with obscured glazing.

Condition : 6 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the of the hereby approved two-storey three bedroom house or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 7 - The front, sides and rear garden shall be divided as shown on the plan drawing numbered 12101-PA-12A and thereafter maintained as such for the duration of the development hereby permitted.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the two-storey three bedroom house hereby approved a detailed plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected along the front, side and rear of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The boundary treatment shall be completed before the two-storey three bedroom house is occupied or in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the local planning authority.

Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 9 - Prior to first occupation of the two-storey three bedroom house hereby approved full details (including manufacturers specifications) of secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than 2 bicycles) for the occupants of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. 

The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Condition : 10 - Prior to first occupation of the two-storey three bedroom house hereby approved details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials for the proposed house shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning authority. The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials (including appearance and layout) shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.

Condition : 11 - a)	No development shall take place until the applicant has entered into a binding arrangement with the Council that will secure the Council's Carbon Offset Fund, in accordance with the zero carbon strategy set out in the Energy Statement hereby approved. 

b)	Prior to first occupation of the two-storey three bedroom house hereby approved evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to demonstrate that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 12 - Prior to first occupation of the approved two-storey three bedroom house evidence (schedule of fittings and manufacturers literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has achieved an internal water use of 105 Litres per person per day or less.

Condition : 13 - The two-storey three bedroom house hereby approved shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of delivery notes, invoices or installation contracts) have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development meets the following:

"	At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) are to achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
"	At least 50% of timber and timber products are to be sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) scheme.
"	No construction or insulation materials are to be used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 14 - "Before the development hereby permitted commences the applicant must either:

a.	Investigate the site for landfill gas to the satisfaction of the LPA, to ascertain whether gas protection measures are required.  Where measures are required the details shall be submitted to, and approved by, the LPA.
Or;

b.	The applicant shall install gas protection measures as a precautionary measure without first investigating the site.  The details of these measures shall be submitted to, and approved by, the LPA.

c.	For a. and b. all required measures shall be installed before the development is first occupied.
